derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, from caes- 'cut, hewn', from the verb caedere

means.word_mean: 1. a pause or interruption (as in a conversation);

sentences.sentence: "after an ominous caesura the preacher continued"

means.word_mean: 2. a break or pause (usually for sense) in the middle of a verse line
